item.title: Report X-2023082057
item.description:
Report X-2023082057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We had gotten a call from our load side area apparently they noticed the hazmat began leaking while going down the IC belt in our building. DescribePack: The box was wet on a specific side due to the leaking that was occurring especially at the top of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once I got to the package I put gloves on and placed it in the lined tote I had brought with me.

item.title: Report X-2023082054
item.description:
Report X-2023082054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was called out from the unload area. I went ahead and investigated to see what was going on with the package and two of the lids on the bottles inside the box were fallen off from transit. DescribePack: The box itself was wet in multiple locations and was starting to look pretty bad and darkened due to the leaking that was occurring. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once I noticed the leaking I immediately placed the hazmat on my cart and brought it to QA where I placed it in a lined tote and placed the package in our hazmat cage.

  • Description: CHECKER WAS UNLOADING TRAILER ABFS 501956 IN 126 DOOR WHEN HE REALIZED THAT PRO #039478859 HAD A ~CRUSHED CARDBOARD CARTON. HE SMELLED FUMES AND NOTIFIED MYSELF DAVID HOSKINS. THERE WAS FREIGHT PRO# ~119816235 SITTING ABOVE THE PAINT THAT WAS NOT SECURED AND IT FELL AND CRUSHED THE BOX'S BELOW. THER E IS GREY ~MATERIAL ON THE FLLOR OF THE TRAILER.

item.title: Report E-2023090643
item.description:
Report E-2023090643

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RDX, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, at 1554 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Charlotte, North Carolina regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons of Aromatic 150 (Petroleum Distillates, n.o.s. (Combustible Liquid) UN1268, 3, III) due to a gasket failure. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to an 2' x 8' area on the trailer floor, and cleaned up the spill without complication, They were able to transfer the remaining product to an IBC plastic tote to continue to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
